title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended by the
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (Gas)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (Gas) 

Levy Order 2024 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 31 December 2024. 

(3) The Electricity Regulation Act, 1999 and Gas (Interim) (Regulation) Act 
2002 (Gas) Levy Order, 2023 (S.I No.600 of 2023) is revoked as and from 1 
January 2025.

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended by the
heading: 2. (1) In this Order -
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order - 

"the Act" means the Electricity Regulation Act, 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as 
amended by the Gas Act; 

"days" means calendar days; 

"Code" means the code of operations of Gas Networks Ireland in relation 
to the transmission system of Gas Networks Ireland as that Code may be 
amended or varied from time to time and any successor code or 
arrangement; 

"the Commission" means the Commission for Regulation of Utilities 
established under the Act; 

"Final Allocations" means Final Allocations at the Exit Points; 

"the Gas Act" means the Gas (Interim) (Regulation) Act, 2002; 

"levy year" means a calendar year; 

"quarter" means a period of 3 months ending on 31 March, 30 June, 30 
September, or 31 December; 

"relevant percentage" for a Shipper in respect of any quarter means the 
percentage (rounded upwards to four decimal places) which the aggregate 
of the Final Allocations allocated to that Shipper in respect of the 
immediately preceding quarter represents of the aggregate of the Final 
Allocations allocated to all Shippers in respect of the immediately 
preceding quarter; 

and any cognate words shall be construed accordingly. 

(2) In this Order unless it is otherwise indicated- 

(a) 

all words and expressions defined in the Act or in the Gas Act 
shall have the same meanings when used in this Order and where 
in any case a word or expression used in this Order is defined in 
each of the Act and the Gas Act, the word or expression shall have

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended by the
heading: 4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant undertaking. This levy will
text_raw:
4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant undertaking. This levy will 

be payable in respect of each levy year. 

(2) The levy imposed by sub-article (1) shall be payable in quarterly 
instalments in each case no later than the day which is 30 days after the date on 
which a request for payment of the levy instalment is made by the Commission.

The levy imposed shall be payable by the relevant undertaking 
separately for each activity of transmission, distribution, or shipping of natural 
gas, as the case may be, that is carried out by the relevant undertaking in Ireland. 

(2) The amount of the levy imposed on a relevant undertaking in respect of 

any quarter shall be as follows: 

(a) 

(b)

in the case of Gas Networks Ireland, in respect of such 
distribution activities, a fixed payment of €775,135; and 

(c) 

in the case of a Shipper, the relevant percentage of €775,135

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended by the
heading: 6. On or before the last day of the first month of each quarter Gas Networks
text_raw:
6. On or before the last day of the first month of each quarter Gas Networks 
Ireland shall supply to the Commission the information required to calculate the 
relevant percentage for each Shipper in respect of the immediately preceding 
quarter. In the event that Gas Networks Ireland fails for any reason to supply any 
of the information required for this purpose the Commission shall be entitled to 
calculate the relevant percentage for any shipper in respect of the last quarter for 
which such information was available.

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended by the
heading: 7. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid within
text_raw:
7. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid within 
the period for payment specified in Article 4, interest thereon shall accrue at the 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [668] 

prescribed interest rate compounded monthly from the date when such payment 
is due until the same is made. 

(2) In this Regulation, "the prescribed interest rate" means a rate 2% per 

annum above the Euribor rate.

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended by the
heading: 8. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank
text_raw:
8. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank 
transfer or equivalent instantaneous transfer of funds to the bank account 
specified by the Commission. 

(2) Relevant undertakings shall notify the Commission as soon as payment 
has been made, indicating the date on which payment was made and the name 
of the bank effecting payment. 

(3) A request for payment by the Commission to the relevant undertakings 
under this Order shall be made to the relevant undertaking in accordance with 
Section 4 of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [668] 5 

Schedule 

The relevant undertakings for the purposes of this Levy Order are a class 
consisting of any person engaged in the transmission or distribution of natural 
gas or as a Shipper. 

Sealed with the common seal of the Commission for 
Regulation of Utilities on 4 December, 2024. 

JIM GANNON, 

Chairperson of the Commission.

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a 
legal interpretation.) 

This order imposes a levy on certain specified classes of natural gas 
undertakings, for the purpose of meeting expenses properly incurred by the 
Commission for Regulation of Utilities in the discharge of its functions under 
the Gas Acts 1976 to 2002.
